* The Command class is an abstract base class for all command types.
* Subclasses of Command must implement the execute method to perform the command's action.
* Executes the command with the provided input, reminder list, and UI.
* Subclasses must provide an implementation for this method.
* @param input The user input string containing the command details.
* @param reminder The Reminder object that manages the task list.
* @param ui The Ui object used to interact with the user.
* @return true if the command was executed successfully, false otherwise.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the input is incomplete or incorrectly formatted.
* @throws TooManyParametersException If too many parameters are provided in the input.
public abstract boolean execute(String input, Reminder reminder, Ui ui) throws EmptyDescriptionException, TooManyParametersException;

* The EmptyDescriptionException is thrown when a required description or input is missing.
* This exception is typically used in commands that require additional details or parameters.
* Constructs a new EmptyDescriptionException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The TooManyParametersException is thrown when a command receives more parameters than expected.
* This exception helps ensure that commands are used correctly with the intended number of parameters.
* Constructs a new TooManyParametersException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The UnsupportedCommandException is thrown when an unsupported or unrecognized command is encountered.
* This exception is used to handle invalid commands that the application does not recognize or support.
* Constructs a new UnsupportedCommandException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The UnsupportedFilePathException is thrown when an invalid or unsupported file path is encountered.
* This exception is used to handle file path errors that prevent successful file operations.
* Constructs a new UnsupportedFilePathException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.

* The Reminder class is responsible for managing the list of tasks (schedule) and their organization in a calendar.
